alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 2:06PM EDT until June 26 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... West central Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 205 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Schnecksville, or 11 miles south of Lehighton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Northampton, Nazareth, Palmerton, Slatington, Bath, Walnutport, Belfast, Kunkletown, Neffs, Coffeetown, New Tripoli, Rossland, Berlinsville, Emerald, Kresgeville, Claussville, Danielsville, Beltzville State Park, Penn Forest Reservoir and Jordan Valley. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 60 and 74, and near mile marker 77. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
